text.p: Centigram Communications Corp expects to report a loss of between $0.80 and $0.90 a share in its second quarter, on lower-than- expected revenues of about $25 million.
The company said the anticipated loss reflected certain one-time restructuring charges and charges for the cancellation of the Voice-TEl acquisition.
It said the revenue shortfall reflected delays in orders from several North American customers. It said its service provider business continued strong, especially internationally.

Centigram, which makes communications platforms integrating voice, data and facsimile, said the restructuring charges related mainly to severance pay associated with the resignation of its president and chief excutive officer and other employees.
